case_vignette: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his foster mother because of complaints from his teachers regarding poor performance at school for the past 8 months. He does not listen to their instructions, often talks during class, and rarely completes his school assignments. He does not sit in his seat in the classroom and often cuts in line at the cafeteria. His foster mother reports that he runs around a lot inside the house and refuses to help his sister with chores and errands. He frequently interrupts his foster mother's conversations with others and talks excessively. She has found him trying to climb on the roof on multiple occasions. He was placed in foster care because of neglect by his biological parents 3 years ago. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. Mental status examination shows a neutral affect.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My teachers say I don't listen to them, I talk a lot in class, and I'm not finishing my schoolwork.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty concentrating, forgetfulness, or hyperactivity?
I run around a lot inside the house, and I can't sit still in my seat at school.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty sleeping, changes in appetite, or mood swings?
No, there's nothing like that; I just have a lot of energy and sometimes try to climb on the roof.
Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?
No, my physical and neurologic examinations didn't show anything wrong.
Have you been taking any medications for any medical conditions?
No, I'm not taking any medications.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as headaches, dizziness, or seizures?
No, I haven't had headaches, dizziness, or seizures.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty controlling your urine or bowel movements?
No, I haven't had any problems like that.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty controlling your emotions or behavior?
Yes, I often interrupt when my foster mom is talking and I don’t really help with chores.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty making friends or socializing with others?
It wasn't mentioned if I have difficulty making friends or socializing with others.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty understanding spoken or written language?
No, I haven't had trouble understanding language; I just don't listen to instructions and talk a lot.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty with memory or attention?
Yes, I have trouble paying attention in class and I don't complete my school assignments.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty with coordination or balance?
No, there's nothing like that going on with me.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty with speech or hearing?
No, I don't have any problems with speaking or hearing.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty with sleep or appetite?
It wasn't mentioned that I have problems with sleep or appetite.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as difficulty with self-control or impulsivity?

trial_0.summarized_conversation: The student's teachers report that they have difficulty listening, talk excessively in class, and struggle to complete schoolwork. They are also described as restless and unable to stay seated at school, as well as running around inside the house. The student denies any issues but admits to having a lot of energy and sometimes attempting to climb on the roof. Physical and neurologic examinations did not reveal any abnormalities, and the student is not taking any medications. They deny experiencing headaches, dizziness, seizures, or difficulties with speaking or hearing. Furthermore, they often interrupt their foster mom and do not assist with household chores. It is not mentioned whether the student has trouble making friends or socializing with others. They also affirm that they have difficulty paying attention in class and fail to complete their assignments. There is no mention of sleep or appetite problems.
trial_0.singleturn_frq: Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

trial_4.summarized_conversation: A 12-year-old child is brought to the clinic as they have been having trouble paying attention in class, talking a lot, and not finishing their schoolwork. The child was placed in foster care due to neglect, so there is limited knowledge about their biological family's health history. The child has not been diagnosed with any medical conditions and denies any changes in their appetite, weight, or sleep. Additionally, the child has been running around at home and not helping with chores, as well as interrupting conversations. The child's hearing and vision are normal, but they talk excessively and often interrupt others. They also report trouble listening to instructions and difficulty completing school assignments. The child's mood has not changed, but they have been more active, running around the house a lot. No changes in appetite or weight have been noted by the child.
